column4: why does ubuntu always get the time wrong when you install it?
it always gets it wrong by an hour
so how did you manage to write to it from windows then?
i just did; _2 there's not way to get them from linux?
I'm just really curious, if windows can't see your swap partition how did you write file to it from windows?
and no, I'm pretty sure you can access the swap partition in the manner you would like to from linux (or any OS as far as I am aware) -_-
_2 I used a windows program that allowed me to read and write ext2/3 & swap, I'd tell the name but it's in the swap partition
oh rite, although I've never heard of that happening it makes a little more sense now, I can only suggest you go back to windows and use the same application to get the files out
yeah _2  has a point, if it is mounted as swap then linux will of probably trashed whatever was on there
_2, you know where I can ask?
i already told what to do
I have no windows computers around
are you sure swap isnt mounted right now?
how did you stop it from mounting?
all files that were placed in it over time have never been erased, even from switching it from windows to linux
